{
    "number": 272073,
    "data": "3,6,15,24,57,90,213,336,795,1254,2967,4680,11073,17466,41325,65184,154227,243270,575583,907896,2148105,3388314,8016837,12645360,29919243,47193126,111660135,176127144,416721297,657315450,1555225053,2453134656,5804178915",
    "name": "Exponents of x in the numerator of cluster variables of rank 2 cluster algebras.",
    "comment": [
        "These numbers are the exponents of x in the numerator of the cluster algebra A(b,c) of rank 2 with parameters b=2 and c=3. Recall that the algebra A(2,3) is a subalgebra of Q(x,y) generated by the following infinite family of variables:",
        "x(n) = (1+x(1-1)^2)/x(n-2) if n is even,",
        "x(n) = (1+x(n-1)^3)/x(n-2) if n is odd.",
        "with x(0)=x and x(1)=y."
    ],
    "link": [
        "Colin Barker, <a href=\"/A272073/b272073.txt\">Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..1000</a>",
        "Andrei Zelevinsky, <a href=\"http://www.ams.org/notices/200711/tx071101494p.pdf\">What is a Cluster Algebra?</a>, AMS Notices 54(11): 1494-1495, (2007).",
        "<a href=\"/index/Rec#order_04\">Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients</a>, signature (0,4,0,-1)."
    ],
    "formula": [
        "a(n) = 4*a(n-2)-a(n-4), with a(2)=3, a(3)=6, a(4)=15, a(5)=24.",
        "G.f.: 3*x^2*(1+x)^2 / (1-4*x^2+x^4). - _Colin Barker_, Apr 22 2016"
    ],
    "program": [
        "(PARI) Vec(3*x^2*(1+x)^2/(1-4*x^2+x^4) + O(x^50)) \\\\ _Colin Barker_, Apr 22 2016"
    ],
    "keyword": "nonn,easy",
    "offset": "2,1",
    "author": "_Hector J. Blandin N._, Apr 19 2016",

    "revision": 21,
    "time": "2016-04-22T16:12:04-04:00",

}
